title: Resources
titleDescription: This is a collection of resources to prepare for the S2G CTF. The first section is a set of different tools that might come in handy during the CTF grouped into CTF categories. The second section is a guide on how to install Kali Linux.
toolsDescription: If you use some tools not mentioned in this list and want to contribute, please send us a message on Discord.
generalDescription: A website that covers many different hacking techniques: hacktricks. Converting between different data formats: CyberChef. A collection of tools and commands for use in CTF: ctf-katana.
webDescription:
Pen testing web applications: burp.
Rest client: insomnia.
forensicsDescription:
A tool for image analysis: aperisolve.
Analyze network traffic: Wireshark.
reversingDescription:
NSA's tool for reverse engingeering: ghidra.
IDA Pro: ida-pro.
osintDescription: Overview of different OSINT sites: osintframework.
cryptoDescription: Collection of tools also used in crypto: dcode.
bufferDescription: A guide on how to perform a stack overflow exploit.

kali.title: Installing Kali Linux
kali.description: This guide assumes you are using Windows 10 64 bit operating system. If you are using macOS or Linux some of these steps will not be similar. If you have any problems please contact us before or during the CTF so we can assist you in installing the recommended setup.
kali.stepOne: 1. Head to virtualbox.org and click the large button "Download VirtualBox 6.1".
kali.stepFour: 4. Open Windows file explorer and navigate to your Downloads folder and execute the file.
kali.stepFive: 5. Go through the installer and click "Yes" when presented with: "Warning: Network interfaces". Also install additional drivers if available.

run.title: Download and run Kali Linux
run.stepOne: 1. Head to Kali and click the button marked in red.
run.stepTwo: 2. Either open in VirtualBox Manager, or save file. If you chose to save file you can import the file to Virtualbox later.
run.stepThree: 3. After the download is finished, this windows should open. Press Import and access agreements etc.
run.stepSix: 6. Change the keyboard layout to Norwegian.
run.tools: Install tools not pre-installed in Kali
run.toolsDescription: Kali Linux is a great distro as there are many programs already installed that is useful in CTF competitions. Sometimes we want to add additional tools that is not already installed. This guide uses terminal commands to install various packages. Open a terminal and paste the commands in the code blocks.
run.toolsTwo: 2. Example installation of a program (Enter password 'kali' when prompted)
run.toolsThree: Two frequent programs that are used in PWN challenges are GDB and Pwntools. These can be installed with the following commands:
run.exampleThree:
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install gdb
git clone https://github.com/longld/peda.git ~/peda
echo "source ~/peda/peda.py" >> ~/.gdbinit
run.exampleFour:
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install python3 python3-pip python3-dev git
libssl-dev libffi-dev build-essential
python3 -m pip install --upgrade pip
python3 -m pip install --upgrade pwntools
